alert.note: Alert for Colorado; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 2:08PM CST until January 25 at 9:40PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Trinity River at Riverside affecting Polk, San Jacinto, Walker and Trinity Counties. Trinity River near Goodrich affecting Polk, Liberty and San Jacinto Counties. Long King Creek near Livingston affecting Polk and San Jacinto Counties. Caney Creek near Splendora affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. San Bernard River near Sweeny affecting Brazoria County. San Bernard River near Boling affecting Wharton, Fort Bend and Brazoria Counties. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Menard Creek near Rye affecting Liberty, Hardin and Polk Counties. Peach Creek at Splendora affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Colorado River at Columbus affecting Wharton and Colorado Counties. For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor, Goodrich, Liberty, Moss Bluff...Major flooding is forecast. For the Long King Creek...including Livingston...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Peach Creek...including Splendora...Minor flooding is forecast. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Colorado River at Columbus. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, At levels above 34 feet minor lowland flooding begins as the flood plain in the vicinity of the gage is inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 32.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 34.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 35.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 35.3 feet on 06/16/1981. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Colorado River Columbus 34.0 32.6 Wed 1 pm CST 32.5 23.7 17.2 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued tonight.Thursday morning at 815 AM CST.
